ReportSection.title: The EPIC Conference (2023)
ReportSection.Static:
AGE-WELL, Canada’s AgeTech network, is dedicated to the creation of technologies and services that benefit older adults and caregivers. Our aim is to help older Canadians maintain their independence, health and quality of life through technologies, programs and services that increase their safety, support their independent living, and enhance their social participation.

AGE-WELL has identified 8 Challenge Areas – difficult and complex problem areas found through extensive public consultation – that demand innovation and deployment of real-world solutions. The EPIC Conference (2023) is an opportunity for AGE-WELL and EPIC-AT students, postdoctoral fellows, research staff and ECRs to share how their research is moving the dial on these issues and improving quality of life for Canada’s older adults and caregivers.

The 9-day virtual conference brings together older adults, caregivers, government and industry partners from around the world for nine virtual sessions, including a trainee-hosted social event.

Oral Presentation
These sessions will be hosted on Zoom and comprise of an introduction to the Challenge Area presented by the session chair and live presentations from researchers and their stakeholder partners.

Please note that presenters are required to accompany their 10-minute talks with a PowerPoint presentation of no more than 10 slides (inclusive of title slide and bibliography).

Priority will be given to presenters who are co-presenting with stakeholders. There will be an additional 5 minutes allocated for Q&A after presentations.

Check out the EPIC Conference 2022 presentations and workshops here.

Call for Abstracts
Presentation proposals are invited from all AGE-WELL HQP including alumni and EPIC-AT Fellows. Applicants are encouraged to review the full challenge area booklet here and ensure they are available for their sessions on the dates below.

Applications will be open in Forum from March 13 – April 10, 2023.
